DOC.brief_summary: To compare safety effectiveness dual anti-platelet therapy cilostazol 100 mg twice daily aspirin 100 mg daily versus monotherapy aspirin 100 mg daily patient undergoing peripheral angioplasty stenting management peripheral arterial disease .
DOC.detailed_description: This multi-center , randomize , single-blinded , phase III , control trial investigating safety effectiveness dual antiplatelet therapy cilostazol 100 mg twice daily aspirin 100 mg daily versus monotherapy aspirin 100 mg daily patient undergoing peripheral , infrainguinal angioplasty stenting management peripheral arterial disease ( intermittent claudication critical limb ischemia ) . The study include total 200 patient randomize 1:1 basis receive either dual antiplatelet therapy 6 month cilostazol 100 mg daily aspirin 100 mg daily versus monotherapy aspirin 100 mg daily 12 month . The study 's primary endpoint composite major adverse cardiovascular event ( cardiovascular death , myocardial infarction , stroke , major amputation , target limb open surgical endovascular revascularization ) . Additional therapy clopidogrel 75mg daily add either group one month case stent placement . Secondary endpoint include quality life assessment use dedicated questionnaire , drug- procedure-related complication rate , target-limb revascularization rate , clinical improvement ( ABI Rutherford-Becker classification change ) . Clinical follow perform 1 , 6 12 month include physical examination , ABI measurement , Rutherford-Becker classification . Maximum follow period 2 year index procedure .
